item.title: A sshlockout Tutorial
item.description: This is a appreciation article to sshlockout. Yep I’m a shill. The sshlockout program is a extra layer of security that bans IP addresses that have reached a maximum threshold of failed password attempts. The sshlockout program originates from DragonFlyBSD and has been ported to OpenBSD. If you’re from the Linux world this is similar to Fail2Ban and is a very simple program. When sshlockout is setup using the settings shown in the manpage it will ban any IP address that exceeds 5 incorrect passwords in one hour.

item.title: How to Setup a OpenBSD Website
item.description: This is a simple tutorial on creating a website in the cloud using OpenBSD, HTTPD and HUGO. This is based on the same steps I used to create the website you’re reading this on. My main focus was on security, minimalism and reliability. I choose OpenBSD because It has amazing security settings out of the box and it’s very lightweight. This tutorial assumes you are a beginner but have some basic knowledge of DNS and unix commands.

item.title: About me
item.description: Hello internet! My name is Dustin and I am currently a Network Administration Technology student at my local college. In my spare time I enjoy working on my homelab and learning about both Windows and Unix-like operating systems. I have a love of Linux and the opensource project that power it. I also like learning about cyber security and how to make systems more secure and reliable. I am a bit of a hardware enthusiast and love to build/upgrade computers and spend hours tweaking the performance and power useage to fit the use of the computer or server.
